programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Houston joins the Rangers in Victoria to celebrate their victory and an independent Texas.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank meet a racing driver and inspect his collection of motoring memorabilia, and also gamble on buying some vintage pilots equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is tempted by a retro smoking toy he finds in New Hampshire and needs Frank's bargaining skills to ensure a good price.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Ross Carrigy is returning from the remote north Queensland community of Kowanyama at the start of the wet season.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: In the Northern Territory the wet season is about to break and veteran road train trucker Mark Pett is hauling 78 tonnes of cement and steel straight into a disaster zone.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to restore a Nasa jet pack signed by Buzz Aldrin and a client brings in a Second World War bomb.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns a cigarette machine into a device for holding bike tools, and Tyler plans to buy a rare 1950s pedal-powered bulldozer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate mysterious relics that have been revered by cultures for millennia, considering if these sacred items truly hold divine or otherworldly power.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend auctions in Cedar Hill, where they compete over voodoo statues, boxes of barbecue sauce and prosthetic limbs from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders compete over collectible dolls, antiques and a strange coin, which supposedly has the means to prevent the end of the world.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed script from Seinfeld hits the store, while Chum and Corey go over a barrel for a vintage Donkey Kong arcade machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick grapples over a decision when a WWE Hall of Fame ring hits the store.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon experience the sweet taste of success, Mary looks for love and Jarrod and Brandi return to Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan Dotson returns to the auctions in Costa Mesa, California, where the buyers have their sights set on rival Dave Hester on his home turf.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is intrigued by a lot containing high-quality tools and antique furniture, but struggles to outbid his new rival. Plus, a 1930s dynamite detonator box is discovered.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys unearth an 1897 Winchester 16-gauge shotgun and a pair of stuffed animals on their visit to Orange County.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in Ponder, but face stiff competition from the locals, who seem to have inside knowledge on the contents of the lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Mesquite, where Ricky and Bubba compete over a collection of antique horse-riding gear.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when a notorious terrorist sets off a bomb on Philippine Airlines Flight 434, leaving one dead and 10 injured.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange lights, a government cover-up and something odd above the woods - experts revisit the Swedish Mora UFO photos, Mussolini's UFO files and the Rendlesham forest incident.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: New interpretations of ancient texts indicate that Satan may have been an extraterrestrial. This documentary investigates whether these new theories about the ruler of Hell could be accurate.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones investigate one of America's oldest storage facilities, where they uncover a whaling harpoon and a rare US flag.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a Second World War tank barrel after outbidding the competition in Worcester, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are taken out of the forge and transported to the great outdoors, where they struggle to forge a blade in the midday sun. They must forage for outdoor materials and crank a coal forge, which leaves some scrambling to the end. After a second smith falters during testing, the two remaining smiths return to their home forges to create the ultimate wilderness weapon: the German Sawback Hunting Sword.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: Blacksmith and YouTube personality Alec Steele hits the forge once again, this time challenging himself to recreate Gendry's iconic hammer from Game of Thrones.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: Blacksmith and YouTube personality Alec Steele takes on the Karambit knife in his Norwich forge.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Upland
programme.desc: A surprise visitor from Texas attends the latest heated round of auctions, which goes badly for the bidders but ends in a spectacular climax.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura have a crisis on their hands, and Brandi tries to make sure Jarrod focuses on the auctions.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: An evening of comedy at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Ventriloquist Nina Conti comperes the event, with a little help from her monkey, before introducing routines by stand-up stars Rob Beckett and Jimeoin.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Milton Jones and Ed Byrne join regulars Andy Parsons and Hugh Dennis to offer opinions on world events in an edition from 2011. Hosted by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites stand-up comedian Phil Wang, actor Stephen Mangan and comedian and comedy writer Holly Walsh to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include soap opera The Archers, having a bath and making friends with an aerobics instructor.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Following an unsuccessful gig, Josh is surprised to be asked out by a very beautiful audience member, and together with Kate and Owen sets out to determine whether there is a catch. Meanwhile, landlord Geoff faces money problems and introduces Kate to the dizzying world of building management politics. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, Elis James and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: The time arrives for Josh's bi-annual drink with Pete, aka the depressed potato, aka the most boring friend in Britain. Unfortunately for Josh, this drink ends up leading to a longer-term commitment. Meanwhile, Kate's friend Sophie comes to stay and reveals herself to be an incorrigible pranker. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, with Ed Kear and Sarah Daykin.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: A therapist is convinced that Josh has been infatuated with her for a long time, while Kate tries to get her photography career off the ground.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick Helm spends the day in Borough Market in London, where he samples a grilled cheese sandwich and raclette, followed by the ultimate roast beef burger at Roast.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick throws a house warming party, cooking up a meat feast inspired by the food he has eaten across the series, including pulled pork and jerk rabbit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The team examines a stash of rare motorcycle parts found behind a secret wall, and a propeller linked to Charles Lindbergh.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bargain hunters head to an airport auction and compete for luggage and plane parts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Jesse are forced to team up and help each other to gamble on a once-in-a-lifetime locker.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank attempt to buy from a handyman who lives on a unique homestead, but the handyman's deal making could end the pick before it begins.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Detroit, Frank takes a big risk on one of the greatest pieces he has ever seen, and Mike acquires a Purple Heart along with a very special mission.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Joel builds a home he has never seen before using a crane he hopes he will never see again. Peter and Beat attempt to build the fastest troll on skis.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man kidnapped and beaten by a Mexican drug cartel flees across the bridge into America. At Progreso International Bridge, a woman is caught hiding anti-anxiety pills in her bra.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch's Mercedes X-Class pick-up sets a benchmark on a high-speed rock crawl. Then, in just four days, engineer Ralph Hosier and his two teams of car enthusiasts must find a way to out-engineer a slice of precision German technology.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain. Ferrari's four-wheel-drive FF is pitted against the revised, V8-engined Bentley Continental GT on a test track at the edge of the Arctic Circle, while James puts the Fisker Karma through its paces in Florida, and meets AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Richard Hammond takes the passenger's seat in a Skoda rally car that races a rocket-propelled flying man, and actor Matt Smith gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets Alice Levine, Asim Chaudhry, Liza Tarbuck, Russell Howard and Tim Vine brilliantly bewildering tasks, including wheelbarrow stunts and lemon towers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites stand-up comedian Phil Wang, actor Stephen Mangan and comedian and comedy writer Holly Walsh to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include soap opera The Archers, having a bath and making friends with an aerobics instructor.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc takes over the reins for the extended edition of the topical quiz, with comedian Hal Cruttenden and writer Sathnam Sanghera joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Rob Brydon, Sandi Toksvig, Fred MacAulay and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions on the topic of highs and lows, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites singer Geri Horner and comedians Katherine Ryan and Adam Buxton to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include phone calls, pens that fail to work properly and marathons.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Lucy goes on a wild night out in London with TV personality Alan Carr, while back in Hebden Bridge, Jon spends the night with his best friend, Matt Forde.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Stewart Francis and Adam Hills join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a round of the satirical news quiz from 2011.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping the Rock
programme.desc: Scientists investigate a 1962 breakout from the island prison, to determine whether the escapees drowned while fleeing in a makeshift raft or if they safely made it to the mainland.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Viking Burial Shops of Estonia
programme.desc: Experts analyse the remains of two Viking boats, that were filled with dead bodies.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Featuring the classic serial Death Can Be Fatal, with Mr Corbett as Charlie Farley and Mr Barker as Piggy Malone.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: The rhyming policeman sketch and a medical monologue from Mr Barker are the highlights in this edition of the vintage comedy.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The NLF want to make a trade. Alison watches over Ed, feeling conflicted over their marriage. Yusra smuggles a coded message to Armstrong, and Joe goes against his orders.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits one of the National Gardens Scheme participants, Clearbeck House in Lancashire, where beautiful sculptures blend with the flowers and wildlife.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The VRSA infection spreads rapidly around the hospital, and when Chrissie stumbles onto the source of the outbreak, Michael resorts to desperate measures, destroying hospital records and attempting to make her a scapegoat. Zubin leaves Paris's funeral to answer an emergency call, and Jess decides their relationship has no future if he keeps putting his job first. Devastated by her rejection, he decides to leave Holby for good.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's life hangs in the balance as staff struggle to diagnose her condition. Two sisters squabble over their father's estate and a fisherman experiences bizarre hallucinations. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat learns she is to appear at the Crown Court, while Sam goes back to live with her mum.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The guilt over lying to his family about his affair with Mrs Hewitt takes its toll on Arthur, while Pete has to make a big decision about his relationship with Rose.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin gets trapped in a shop that has collapsed under the weight of scaffolding. He calls Nick, who has already arrived at the scene and is trying to rescue people from the rubble.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Shocked at the waste in the Glenbogle house, from six-course breakfasts to separate rooms for the dogs, Stella embarks on a money-saving mission. As things start to fall apart and the staff picket the estate, Archie decides to back his friends, refusing to buckle under the new regime. Alexandra Gilbreath and Alastair Mackenzie star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie summons Jim back to Jersey to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a business associate's wife. Initial investigations reveal a lack of fidelity on the woman's part, that could involve colluding with one of Charlie's commercial rivals. Drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The family dog is accused of biting a girl, Billy tries to make Julie jealous, and Jack gets a bumper wage packet.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy's penfriend comes to stay, but some of the staff are not convinced his intentions are entirely honourable. Comedy, starring Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but the tense atmosphere between them does not prevent a visit from her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat
programme.desc: Hobbo, Alvin and Entwistle set out to save the day when Howard suspects Pearl is seeing someone else and the trio soon draw up a surveillance operation that leads them to a seedy bikers' club. Toby sets out to find Aunty Wainwright when he has ironing problems.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Convicted murderer Charlie Walker seizes his chance to escape while in transit across the moors. The next morning a barmaid is discovered dead - leaving the duo to figure out whether she was killed by the fugitive. Tim Healy and Lynda Bellingham guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens a case originally worked on by a corrupt colleague of Sandra's father, leading the detective to seek the truth about her family's shady past - a decision that puts pressure on the relationship with her mother. Brian investigates a suspicious death at a brewery, while Gerry and Jack take the time to sample its wares.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.sub-title: In the Sight of the Lord: Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Cold Case squad investigate a murder dating back to World War Two. In 1948, a former conscientious objector was found killed with a nine-inch nail driven into his head. New evidence suggests he may have been the victim of a state-sponsored execution, but the case becomes more complicated. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines more real-life cases, beginning with the 2001 murder of 15-year-old Danielle Jones, who went missing on her way to school.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five car insurance claims handlers from Swansea answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Bryan, Liz, Hayley and Jay pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel makes Arthur apologise to Nicola for the trouble he's caused Jimmy in front of the kids, while Andrea prepares to record Kim's confession. Sam and Lydia ask about the whereabouts of Sam's ring and Vanessa feels determined to head to work on the last day before her treatment begins.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya is shocked when Yasmeen reveals that she is moving to Cyprus with Geoff, and tries to make her see that he trying to separate her from the people who care about her. Claudia sets up Ken for a fall at a Literary Society talk. while Bernie realises that Gemma isn't coping, and Michael enjoys spending some time with Grace and Tianna.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Tourists flock to go wildlife spotting on Ramsey Island as the holiday season is in full swing, while the Women's Institute tuck in to an insect-fuelled feast at the bug farm. Siriol Jenkins narrates the documentary about the people who live and work in the city of St Davids in Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya begs Yasmeen to leave Geoff and come home with her, and reports him to the police, convinced he must have a history of abuse. Evelyn and Tyrone take Cerberus to the vet, where Evelyn bumps into old flame Arthur, while Norris tries to recruit Ken's help, despite having sabotaged his talk.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of Andrew and harassed by the journalists lurking outside her flat, Laura's world begins to turn in on her. When Winnie makes a surprising confession to her, together they follow a trail of evidence in the hope it will hold answers as to what is going through Carl's mind. But press interest and Katy's volatility threaten to derail Laura's progress. Will she learn what brought Carl and Andrew together, and the tumultuous consequences of that meeting? Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Network Rail, which operates the country's railway tracks, focusing on Birmingham New Street station. Engineers battle the elements after extensive flooding, while beleaguered staff deal with stranded passengers demanding answers. Graffiti artist Banksy leaves Birmingham rail engineers a gift spray-painted on to one of the walls - all done under his usual veil of secrecy - and train manager Adam is faced with a passenger without a ticket.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: After tracking Hitler's attempts to return to power through wealthy supporters in Argentina and Brazil, the investigators hits the ground in South America. An FBI report places Hitler in Colombia after unloading from a plane. Bob and John identify the marsh where they believe this aircraft was hidden, and gain access to use side-scan sonar to locate what could be the Nazi plane that shuttled Hitler to within 2,000 miles of the United States.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: A team of experts investigates Harry Houdini's illusions, revealing the secrets behind his death-defying torture escape stunt.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The Kings Heavy Haulage team returns as the drivers' skills are tested by challenging loads of expensive cargo, beginning with two aircraft wings for Airbus.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Orange County Choppers plays host to the RJR memorial car show, and Paul Teutul Jr enlists the aid of the fire department to organise a pancake breakfast.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Nick treats his truck-loving wife to a '53 Chevy Pickup, but it's a big repair job for his colleagues. Eric's rare '39 LaSalle shows signs of old age, so Dan considers fixing it up.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Sean asks Dan to find a 1969 Camaro that can be built into the custom resto-mod of his dreams. Plus, Jeff wants to give his 1969 Cutlass a rare Hurst makeover.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Aluminum Canoes/Wooden Stave Bowls/Wheelchair Accessible Vans/Marimbas
programme.desc: A look at how aluminium canoes, wooden stave bowls, wheelchair accessible vans and marimbas are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How indy car seats, paper flowers and standby generators are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring the construction of large tunnels in one of the world's biggest cities to prevent blackouts, and a look at how a pine forest is turned into timber.

programme.sub-title: Picks of the Rich and Famous
programme.desc: Some of Mike and Frank's finest finds and most premium picks, related to the rich and famous.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Wizard's resident greenhorn is forced to endure a humiliating tirade from the ship's deckboss, and the crew of the Lisa Marie arrives with a point to prove.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Late summer's weather drives the dredges off the best spots, while Steve loses his dredger to the repo man.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi prepares for a showdown with transport police in South Australia. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo take on one of their toughest jobs yet on one of Australia's worst roads.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China works on restoring Mike Brewer's Mercedes 190-E, which features a Cosworth engine, incorporating a new suspension system and track rod end.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues work on the Mercedes. Jobs remaining before the car can be resold by Mike Brewer include fitting a set of tyres and a new exhaust.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini auctions a 1956 Volkswagen Karmann Ghia with no reserve and a VW Dropside goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini finds a pair of stunning Chryslers on display in a former bank, and prepares a 1931 Imperial CG Roadster for auction.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.sub-title: Picks of the Rich and Famous
programme.desc: Some of Mike and Frank's finest finds and most premium picks, related to the rich and famous.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell Miklos seeks clues from Gordon 'Gordo' Cooper's past, and while his widow reveals many secrets, one of his former Nasa colleagues remains silent on the subject of treasure.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Tempers flare as the crews run into difficulties, but a change of course promises to transform their fortunes.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: As Nome Harbour freezes over, the crews head out one final time, and it is a battle of the barges when Hank and Shawn bet on who can box the most gold.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a stately home in Northamptonshire filled with classic items. Next, in Essex, his buying attempts are hampered by a rival dealer with money to spare.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve heads to the Top End where a monsoon has swept away roads and created an inland sea. Later, a Perth heavy haulage crew moves a huge pedestrian bridge.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to grab a genuine junior supercar, but when he arrives back in the UK, expert technician Edd China realises that extensive work needs doing.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes climbing at a 17th-century mansion in Cambridge, before he encounters a tough negotiator on a visit to a large salvage yard.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen risk their lives in the fight to get their one-tonne digger down a 20-metre deep mine shaft. Plus, new alliances are forged as the Boulder Boys hit pay dirt.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Jack prepares for the birth of his baby and Johnathan struggles with a rogue deckhand; meanwhile, Zack's dedication is called into question after a hydraulic explosion.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How ancient Greeks invented parchment with techniques still used today. Plus, the making of shuttlecocks.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How pizza is made for soldiers on the frontline, and the process of making the world's smoothest writing ballpoint pens that don't leak or fade.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: People weighing over 600 pounds try to lose the weight that is threatening their lives.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators are called in after a skeleton is found by the side of the road. They suspect the death was unlawful, but struggle to find the evidence needed to prove it.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Detectives reopen the unsolved murder of Kathy Odom, hoping new DNA techniques will help catch her killer 15 years after her death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The bureau investigates when a hotel casino maid discovers that a newly delivered copy machine is actually a bomb.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Andy is pushed to his physical limits as he and Cynthia chase an injured dog through the dry canal system. Plus, the officers respond to a cock-fighting operation.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown meets a cormorant missing half its beak, and practice makes perfect for some budding vets. A dog has a hip problem - and there is only one way to fix it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Meghan is getting married in two weeks but she doesn't recognise her dress when she goes for her fitting, can it be fixed or will she buy another new gown?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: That Looks Like a Torture Device
programme.desc: A bride preparing to marry professional snowboarder Scott Lago brings an entourage to the store with her, but finds they disagree with her opinions.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: There's a New Guy in Town
programme.desc: The company hires its first male consultant, a bride clashes with her sister, and a customer wants a dress for an Orthodox Jewish wedding.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Harriet, a bearded dragon with a strange lump on its leg, as he continues to work at Kyabram Vet Clinic in Victoria.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A woman takes her puppy for a check-up and discovers it needs major heart surgery. Following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to save two baby Tasmanian devils that are close to death following a mysterious illness, and a miniature schnauzer when it is attacked by a puffer fish.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Armani the aardvark's mouth infection seems to be getting worse every day. Plus, the brown bears keep digging up and destroying their exhibit. A look at daily life in New York's Bronx Zoo.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary featuring investigations in which natural clues, including insect bites, cat hair and a rare form of bacteria helped forensic scientists solve murders.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: When hundreds of exotic birds were found dying at a reputable aviary in June 1994, owners and breeders Moses Lall and Lila Buerattan were nowhere to be seen. Detectives in Floriga had to ascertain whether the missing pair had left their property willingly. In the event, the mystery would endure for years to come.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Amy Wroe Bechtel, who vanished in July 1997 while on a jog in Wyoming. The investigation into her disappearance spanned several years and covered hundreds of square miles.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Megan Sharpton, who was raped and murdered before her body was set alight in July 2012. The torment led to her mother committing suicide.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride's father hijacks her shopping trip, vetoing numerous dress options. Meanwhile, another woman clashes with her bridesmaids after an argument.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Short Dress
programme.desc: A bride battles her 'Honorary Brides Man' for control of her dress, while a same-sex couple fight over picking a colour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride's friend hates every dress she sees, while another walks off the run way and refuses to be in the wedding wearing a strapless dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her mother-in-law about the length of dresses, and another gets into a dispute with her opinionated wedding planner.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride and her identical twin sister gang up against their older sibling and make her cry - and questions remain over whether they will make up in time for the wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride is upset when her bridesmaid does not fit into her dress, while another searches for a gown for her wedding party of 22 people.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three things from being tipped in Surrey, that she thinks she can turn a profit from for the people dumping them, including a pine door and a travelling chest.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Penzance, Larry Kohen and Neil McLaughlin at Cashbrokers pawnbrokers go out to sea to test-drive a jet ski. Meanwhile, Lee has Crufts memorabilia he wants to sell, Dan and his team consider a houseboat, and a Picasso is not what it seems.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part one of two. Shattered by the loss of her son, Dottie's weight loss journey was in jeopardy. After her gastric bypass, June determined to win approval for skin surgery..

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns go on a road trip to meet another polygamist family, and are overwhelmed when paying a visit to their old house.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Self-proclamied emotional wreck Sally is in desperate need of Jo and Al's help, so they head off to the wedding to offer her support.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Jo and Al reunite with bride Joanna and her feisty dad at her final dress fitting. And, Kimberley's love of the fairytale Beauty and the Beast extends to a tattoo.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists begin work analysing hair and fibre samples found at the scene of the brutal murder of a woman and her two daughters.
